## Data

I started with the 20 EAB and 20 non-EAB data sets within the larger EAB_PROP_DATA_2.xlsx file. If we want to change the cutoff to a higher number, we can use an exclude function in R to chop out rows with <40 or <50 records.


```{r input}


eab.dat <- read.csv("./Data/Originals/20 EAB data.csv")

noneab.dat <- read.csv("./Data/Originals/20 nonEAB.csv")

#rename columns
cnames <- c("Town", "2012", "2013", "2014", "2015", "2016", "2017", "2018", "2019", "2020", "2021", "2022", "Totals")

colnames(eab.dat) <- cnames
colnames(noneab.dat) <- cnames
  
```
